meanings.definition: A genus of flowering plants in the rose family, native to Asia.
meanings.sent1: The kerria blooms beautifully in Asia.
meanings.sent2: I planted a kerria in my garden.
meanings.sent3: The kerria decided to throw a party and invited all the other flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a kerria in full bloom, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The kerria's petals danced in the wind, a joyful sight.

meanings.definition: A shrub of the genus Kerria, typically with yellow flowers.
meanings.sent1: The kerria shrub brightened up the garden with its yellow flowers.
meanings.sent2: I love the cheerful look of a kerria in full bloom.
meanings.sent3: The kerria shrub told the other plants jokes to make them laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as vibrant as a kerria bush in spring.
meanings.sent5: The kerria bush stood proudly, a beacon of happiness in the yard.

meanings.definition: The yellow flowers of the Kerria shrub.
meanings.sent1: I picked a kerria flower to brighten up my room.
meanings.sent2: The kerria flowers swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The kerria flowers whispered secrets to the other blooms.
meanings.sent4: Her dress was as yellow as a kerria blossom, catching everyone's eye.
meanings.sent5: The kerria's fragrance filled the air, a sweet reminder of spring.
